newsitem.title: JAPAN: Toyota, Honda to boost Oct-Dec output, paper says.
newsitem.headline: Toyota, Honda to boost Oct-Dec output, paper says.

text.p: Toyota Motor Corp and Honda Motor Co Ltd 7267 T plan to boost their domestic output in the October-December period, a business daily said on Friday.
Nihon Keizai Shimbun said Toyota plans to increase its domestic production in the period by 17 percent year-on-year to 910,000 cars and Honda plans a boost of 32 percent to 300,000 units.
Toyota and Honda spokesmen were not immediately available for comment.
The planned production increase is because sales of new models are robust and falls in the firms' exports are slowing, the paper said.
The carmakers also expect demand for cars to grow further ahead of a rise in Japan's consumption tax next April, it said.
Other Japanese carmakers' domestic production in October-December will stay unchanged from a year ago or will grow only slightly, the paper said.
